model

Class AbstractPropertyModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.AbstractPropertyModel
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleModel

    public abstract class AbstractPropertyModel
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract model which handles the basic functions of adding, removing, and firing events to property change listeners. This class exists to provide an API for interacting with all models that need to pass property changes to controllers in this program. This class should only be inherited by Java Bean classes that hold values tracking the state of various elements in the program.
    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Craig

    • Method Detail

      • addPropertyChangeListener

        public void addPropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Adds a property change listener to this model.
        Parameters:
        listener - the property change listener to add to this model.

      • removePropertyChangeListener

        public void removePropertyChangeListener(java.beans.PropertyChangeListener listener)
        Removes a property change listener from this model.
        Parameters:
        listener - the property change listener to remove from this model.

      • firePropertyChange

        protected void firePropertyChange(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                  java.lang.Object oldValue,
                                  java.lang.Object newValue)
        Fires a property change event for a bound property of this model.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property.
        oldValue - the old value of the property.
        newValue - the new vale being assigned to this property.

      • setProperty

        public abstract void setProperty(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                 java.lang.Object newValue)
        Polymorphic method to change a property value in this model. It should be implemented using conditional logic to assign the new value to the appropriate property based on the property name.

        An Exception is to be thrown if the Object to be set as the new value of the property is not the correct type.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - the name of the property.
        newValue - the new value to be assigned to the property.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Object to be set as the new value of the property is the wrong type.
